result.execSummary:
The defendant William S Plummer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid at 50.00 per month commencing 05-01-2016 or serve 6 days jail, consecutive as penalty for non payment.
DNA Sample/Surcharge waived.
The firearm listed in the criminal complaint is to be returned to the Defendant.  Attorney Crawford is to file an order for the Courts review.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William S Plummer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order for return of firearm.
Signed by Judge Aprahamian on 4/13/16.
From Atty Crawford dated 4/7/16 with attached proposed order.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant William S Plummer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
FINE:  $265.60 (to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 5/1/16 OR SERVE 6 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment. 
DNA SAMPLE/SURCHARGE WAIVED BASED ON DATE OF VIOLATION.
The firearm listed in the criminal complaint is to be returned to the Defendant.  Attorney Crawford is to file an order for the Courts review.
Filed by State.
Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine - Prior Convictions
Filed by State.
From State dated 1/26/15 informing Court of possible adjournment request at jury status if not resolved.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person at 04-12-2016 08:15 am
Jury status hearing at 04-07-2016 09:30 am

Defendant William S Plummer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Crawford requests and adjournment and that the case be set for jury trial.   The Court grants the request and sets the matter for trial. Attorney Crawford requests the Court modify bond in regards to the Defendant's possession of weapons.  The State objects to the request for modification.  The Court denies the request for bail modification.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-08-2016 09:30 am

Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court.   Defendant William S Plummer did not appear.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization  Attorney Crawford advises the Court he has received a new pretrial offer and requests the court set the matter for plea and sentencing.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 12-07-2015 08:30 am

Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court.   Defendant William S Plummer did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Crawford has received discovery and an offer. Attorney Crawford requests additional time for negotiations.  Attorney Crawford to advise how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 11-04-2015 08:30 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms other than as they are presently secured in his premises.

Defendant William S Plummer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
